The Guanghua Gate is located in Seoul, South Korea, one of the symbols of Seoul. The history of the Guanghua Gate dates back to the Korean Dynasty and was the main gate of the time. Today, the Guanghua Gate has become an important landmark in South Korea, attracting many tourists to visit. The architecture of the Guanghua Gate is unique, adopting traditional Korean architectural style, and is in stark contrast to the modern architecture surrounding it. On the Guanghua Gate Square, there are many sculptures and monuments that showcase the history and culture of Korea. In addition, Guanghuamen is an important venue for Korean political and cultural activities, often holding various concerts, art exhibitions and other activities. In short, Guanghuamen is a good place to understand Korean history and culture, and a good place to feel the modern atmosphere of Korea.

Xinguanghua Gate was just remodeled in October 2023. The old white-bottomed black-bottomed gold-bottomed word was replaced with black-bottomed gold. The door was covered with a similar bridge shape (not a real bridge) connected to the road. It is said to be the restoration of the shape of the Korean Dynasty, symbolizing the connection between the royal family and the people in the king's city. The shape was destroyed during the Japanese colonial rule, and the project aims to restore the original photochemical gate square, which is worth recommending to experience the new photochemical gate.
